title: 114_hr470
content: The "Chattahoochee-Oconee National Forest Land Adjustment Act of 2015" allows for the disposal of isolated National Forest System land in Georgia that is inefficient to manage or has lost its value. Proceeds from the land sale will be used by the Forest Service to purchase land for National Forest purposes in Georgia. The term "Secretary" in the Act refers to the Secretary of Agriculture. The Secretary is authorized to sell or exchange United States' rights in National Forest System land in Georgia. The land subject to sale or exchange consists of 30 tracts totaling approximately 3,841 acres. Maps depicting the land are available for public inspection. The Secretary may modify boundaries based on land management considerations. The Secretary may convey land sold under this Act by quitclaim deed and reserve any necessary rights-of-way. Land may not be sold for less than market value, determined by appraisal. Consideration for a sale or exchange must be paid in cash. The Secretary may sell land under this Act through public or private sale, including auctions, and may solicit offers for the sale or exchange of land. Brokers or third parties can be used in the land disposition process. The Secretary may use brokers or third parties to sell land authorized by this Act and pay commissions or fees from the proceeds of the sale. SEC. 4. TREATMENT OF PROCEEDS. The Secretary shall deposit sale proceeds in the fund established under the Sisk Act for land acquisition in Georgia. Funds can only be used with owner consent.
